Name: Physics - For use with the IB Diploma Programme: Topic 3: Thermal Physics. First Assessment 2016 (Volume 3)

ReviewList.Text: This physics textbook by Michael Dickinson is a huge asset when teaching or learning IB physics.  The diagrams are incredibly helpful for conceptual understanding.  Many of the examples are exactly like what the students will see on upcoming IB exams.  I have taught IB physics for 6 years, and have previously spent a great deal of time having students write out definitions and draw diagrams.  Some of that was helpful, but students can also use this book as pre-written notes, and spend more of their time discussing concepts and practicing tough problems.  While the black and white version is good, I would recommend the color version more.  Many diagrams, especially those in the waves unit that relate to light, need the color to get their meaning across more.

I think this book does well in reviewing the concepts that you need to know for the exam. However, it should not be considered a standalone textbook. You would want to get a full blown Physics textbook to use in conjunction with this text.
Exactly what I expected. Kinda disappointed that a few HL choices are left out though... I guess I'll just choose the others
Good explanation and detailed problem solving.
